Definition: Name of field of header rows before data
Name of sample
Type of sample (e.g. Liquid>aqueous; sediment; etc). Uses a controlled vocabulary from IGSN SESAR (https://www.geosamples.org/).
Dissolved inorganic carbon reported as carbon. 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code.
Ammonium reported as ammonium (rather than as nitrogen). 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code.
Bromide. 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code.
Calicium. 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code.
Chloride. 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code.
Fluoride. 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code.
Lithium. 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code.
Magnesium. 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code.
Nitrate reported as nitrate (rather than as nitrogen). 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code.
Nitrite reported as nitrite (rather than as nitrogen). 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code.
Phosphate reported as phosphate (rather than as phosphorus). 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code.
Potassium. 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code.
Sodium. 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code.
Sulfate reported as sulfate (rather than as sulfur). 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code.
Dissolved organic carbon measured as non-purgeable organic carbon (NPOC) and reported as carbon.  5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code.
Total dissolved nitrogen [nitrate + nitrite + ammonia + organic-N] reported as nitrogen. 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code.
Total suspended solids. 5-digit prefix refers to a US Geological Survey parameter code.
Fourier transform ion cyclotron resonance mass spectrometry (FTICR-MS).

Deviations from the methods codes listed in the header rows. If a row has a methods deviation, it indicates that the sample from that row uses the methods indicated in the deviations column when they conflict with the methods written in the header rows above (MethodID_*).
Unit of measurement that applies to a given column in the dataset.
Basis of the units listed in the column.
Method code defining information about inspection of the samples that led to the data presented in the column.
Method code defining information about storage of the samples that led to the data presented in the column.
Method code defining information about preservation of the samples that led to the data presented in the column.
Method code defining information about preparation of the samples that led to the data presented in the column.
Method code defining information about analysis of the samples that led to the data presented in the column.
Method code defining information about data processing that led to the data presented in the column.
Analytical detection limit.
Precision of the data values.
State of data readiness for publication and use.
Unique site ID.
Data collection date.
Local time zone.
The name of field staff involved in data collection; recorded as "FirstName_LastName" and separated by semicolons.
Site arrival time. Recorded in Pacific Standard Time.
Site departure time. Recorded in Pacific Standard Time.
Weather conditions (sunny; partly cloudy; overcast; raining; other) during data collection.

General type of vegegation present in the riparian corridor. Up to two of the following types may be selected if mixed: needleaf evergreen tree; needleaf deciduous tree; broadleaf evergreen tree; broadleaf deciduous tree; shrub; grass; crop; and/or not vegetated.
General hydrogeomorphology of river. One of the following classes may be selected: multi-channel (braided); single-channel straight; single-channel meandering.
General gradient of river. One of the following classes may be selected: relatively flat/gentle gradient (e.g.; valleys) or relatively steep gradient (e.g.; mountainous or hilly terrain).
Estimated dominant sediment type/size class of streambed. Size/type classes include gravel/cobble (>2mm); sand; silt/mud (<0.0625mm); or bedrock (primarily).
Estimated canopy cover over the river only. Total riparian zone canopy cover does not apply. One of the following classes may be selected: >70%; 30-70%; 5-30%; or none.
Estimated macrophyte cover in the river. One of the following classes may be selected: >70%; 30-70%; 5-30%; or none.
Estimated algal mat cover on riverbed. One of the following classes may be selected: >70%; 30-70%; 5-30%; or none.
Geographic location (latitude) of site.
Geographic location (longitude) of site.
Accuracy of GPS location data accuracy; measured in feet.
Free text field to record notes related to the site visit; including weather; site disturbance; sensor installation difficulties; or other information relevant to the quality of data collected.
Name of sample.
International Geo Sample Numbers (IGSNs) registered with System for Earth Sample Registration (SESAR; https://www.geosamples.org/about/services#igsnregistration).
The IGSN for each site ID.
Informal classification of sample.
Method of sample collection registered in the SESAR system (controlled vocabulary from SESAR).
Description of how sample was collected.
Name of study associated with sample.
Type of physical feature that sample was collected from (suggested vocabulary from SESAR).
Name of field site where sample was collected.
Country where sample was collected.
Name of field program or cruise registered in the SESAR system.
Name of person who collected the sample.
Date of sample collection.
Related URL associated with the samples.
Type of URL associated with the samples.
Name of the phsyiographic feautre (river).
State or province.
Name of method code category.
Alphanumeric ID associated with method code.
Type of method.
Description of method code.
Instrument used in method code.
Laboratory in which methods were completed.
Name of files in the dataset/data package.
A brief description of the files in the dataset/data package.
ESS-DIVE Reporting Format or other standard applied to the data file.
The earliest date in the file.
The latest date in the file.
Missing value codes.
File path within the data package.
Column headers from each csv file in the dataset.
Unit of measurement that applies to a given column in the dataset.
Description of the information in a given column in the dataset.
Type of data (numeric; text; date; time; datetime).
Indicates whether the header is a column header or row header.
